comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Legendary Adventurers' Guild, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 44127607@N04
comment._content:
That's definitely the customized S38 "Osa's Arc."
 What a delightfully quirky shot of a truly fascinating woman.

comment.author: 45447224@N08
comment._content: They bought 2 Sikorskys in 1932; one a ten-seater (pictured) painted in zebra stripes named "Osa's Ark", and a five-seater named "Spirit of Africa" painted in giraffe spots. "Osa'a Ark" was modified by removing seats to make room for equipment and install 2 sleeping bunks. It also had a tiny washroom, tiny gasoline stove (!) and food staples. Martin designed and installed a unipod camera mounting for aerial photography. All detailed in Osa's book I Married Adventure.

comment.author: 23699657@N03
comment._content: she is amazing.  i live in chanute, ks where she is from!

comment.author: 47980961@N08
comment._content: She was amazing, it's not politically correct in this day and age but there is a great black and white movies of Martin filming a charging rhino and Osa shoots it just before it would have hit him, it falls dead at his feet! How's that for trusting the person you're married to with your life??? She was a remarkable shot with a rifle, luckily for Martin. I'm reading the book she wrote that was published after her death called 'Last Adventure', about her last trip to Borneo with Martin.
